text: John Lysak (August 16, 1914 â€“ January 8, 2020) was an American canoeist. He competed in the Olympic Games in 1936 in Berlin. He was born in Bound Brook, New Jersey. Lysak competed in the 1936 Olympics in Men's Folding Kayak Doubles, 10 kilometres, finishing seventh. After a stint in the United States Marine Corps during World War II, Lysak worked as a painting contractor until the age of 62. He was the San Francisco Bay Area's oldest living Olympian. ==References== Category:1914 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Olympians for the United States Category:American adoptees Category:American military personnel of World War II Category:Sportspeople from New Jersey Category:Sportspeople from New York (state) Category:People from Yonkers, New York Category:American centenarians Category:Military people from New Jersey Category:United States Marine Corps personnel Category:Kayakers
title: John Lysak
